question.body: Kidneys help synthesize calcitriol, an enzyme which is found in the digestive, endocrine, and integumentary systems. Explain how calcitriol benefits the entire body.

multiple_choice.choice: Calcitriol is necessary to help regulate volume of lymph and interstitial fluid.
Calcitriol is necessary as it allows for the passage and direction of sperm.
Calcitriol is necessary for the absorption of dietary calcium in the digestive and integumentary systems which promotes bone reabsorption in the endocrine system.
Calcitriol is necessary to prevent abnormal function of enzymatic pathways in the respiratory system.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Kidneys increase/decrease reabsorption of water filtered from blood help regulate volume of lymph and interstitial fluid. This works in conjunction with the lymphatic/ immune system.
Incorrect. In the urinary system, the urethra in males acts as a dual passageway for urine and sperm. Calcitriol is independent of the reproductive system.
Correct. Calcitriol is necessary for the absorption of dietary calcium in the digestive and integumentary systems which promotes bone reabsorption in the endocrine system.
Incorrect. Kidneys work with lungs to adjust the pH of body fluid which prevents abnormal function of enzymatic pathways. Calcitriol is independent of the respiratory system.

part.hint: Calcitriol is form of vitamin D
